tech_proof_start: ^Stack: "okay. okay. i got my whole coffee beans out."
^You watch Stack's screen through the codec. Cursor moving fast. Too fast.
^Stack: "no. i need to prove it works. i NEED to."
^The prototype is 80% done. Stack is sprinting on fumes and self-harm.
^Let Stack finish alone (high risk, high reward)
^Have EvilFear jump in to help (safer, less impressive)
^Call it early, show what we have (safe, lower impact)
stack_solo: ^Stack: "i can do this. i can do this. i can do this."
^The codec goes silent except for keystrokes. You watch Stack disappear into the zone.
^Stack: "...i feel bad. did i abandon the big thing for this?"
^Roo: "you just proved he's worth extracting. breathe."
^The crew knows Stack is running on nothing now. But it worked.
evil_helps: ^EvilFear: "i have a heat gun and 12 minutes. trust me."
^You watch them work in parallel. Stack on code, EvilFear on hardware mods to make it look mean.
^The demo runs. Solid. Not miraculous, but real.
show_partial: ^Roo: "we're calling it. show what we have."
^Hübris: "neither are you. we're not burning you for one demo."
^The demo runs. It's incomplete. They can see the potential, but it's rough.
^Roo: "you survived. we'll ship the real thing next cycle."
^The crew is intact, but the momentum stalls.
